abstract: BrightSource Energy, backed by Google and other companies, is planning to build a large-scale solar power plant in the California desert.
snippet: BrightSource Energy, backed by Google and other companies, is planning to build a large-scale solar power plant in the California desert.
lead_paragraph: The United States Department of Energy offered a $1.37 billion loan guarantee on Monday to a California company planning to build a large-scale solar power plant in the Southern California desert.

headline.main: U.S. Offers Solar Project a Crucial Loan Guarantee
headline.print_headline: U.S. Offers Solar Project A Crucial Loan Guarantee

abstract: Sukhinder Singh Cassidy, Google’s former president of Asia-Pacific and Latin America operations, will become chief executive of Polyvore, an online shopping and fashion start-up.
snippet: Sukhinder Singh Cassidy, Google’s former president of Asia-Pacific and Latin America operations, will become chief executive of Polyvore, an online shopping and fashion start-up.
lead_paragraph: From Claire Cain Miller at Bits:

headline.main: Polyvore Taps Ex-Google Executive as Chief

abstract: BrightSource Energy, backed by Google and other companies, has won a a $1.37 billion loan guarantee from the United States Department of Energy to build a large-scale solar power plant in the California desert, The New York Times reported.
snippet: BrightSource Energy, backed by Google and other companies, has won a a $1.37 billion loan guarantee from the United States Department of Energy to build a large-scale solar power plant in the California desert, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: The United States Department of Energy offered a $1.37 billion loan guarantee on Monday to a California company planning to build a large-scale solar power plant in the Southern California desert, The New York Times’s Todd Woody reported.

headline.main: U.S. Offers Solar Project a Crucial Loan Guarantee

abstract: Our Tuesday morning roundup of technology news also includes a look at the continuing digital divide and more on Apple’s decision to remove sex-related iPhone applications from the App Store.
snippet: Our Tuesday morning roundup of technology news also includes a look at the continuing digital divide and more on Apple’s decision to remove sex-related iPhone applications from the App Store.
lead_paragraph: Tuesday morning’s roundup of technology news:

headline.main: Bits Scan: Inside Google, the Future of Gaming and Data Breaches

abstract: Intel said it was the victim of a cyber-attack in January, around the same time that Google was a victim of a broad-based attack that started in China.
snippet: Intel said it was the victim of a cyber-attack in January, around the same time that Google was a victim of a broad-based attack that started in China.
lead_paragraph: 7:20 p.m. | Updated  Adding update from Intel spokesman about the possibility of other similarities between the Google and Intel attacks.

headline.main: Intel Was Attacked at the Same Time as Google
